Articles.Content: Does it have to do with the origin point. (the pink dot in blender) Or the actual origins in the modeling graph? I was wondering due to my nacelles being extremely wobbly under high thrust.

The attachment point is a little irrelevant since the physics engine will calculate the center of mass from the total distribution of weight, and will determine the center of rotation based on that plus the drag.

You issue is one of length and the thrust applied from so far away from the center of mass. It's also likely that the weight of your part is set too low.

Either shorten your part, reduce its rated thrust, or increase its rated weight.

However it may also be affected by the shape of your collision node. Make sure your mating surfaces are flat and that your CFG file coordinates for those locations are as precise as possible.
